"Karuizawa" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 483. ==History== Karuizawa is on the southern slope of Mount Asama. In the Edo period, it was a waystation on the Kisokaido road. In the early Meiji period, the area was developed as a health resort. It is a popular tourist spot for people from Tokyo who travel to Karuizawa to get away from the summer heat. ==References== ==Other websites== Category:Towns in Japan Category:Settlements in Nagano Prefecture
